normalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! Film buffs, get ready because the festival season is heating up! Across India, from the serene hills of Shillong to the bustling streets of Mumbai, film festivals are popping up faster than you can say "cut!" The buzz is all about independent cinema, regional narratives, and of course, celebrity sightings. The Chennai International Film Festival just wrapped up, showcasing some truly groundbreaking Tamil cinema. And folks are already prepping for the Kolkata Film Festival later this year, known for its eclectic mix of international and Bengali films. Beyond the screenings, these festivals are a cultural melting pot, a place where filmmakers meet distributors, and audiences discover hidden gems. Think delicious biryani stalls, endless chai breaks, and late-night discussions that stretch into the early hours. Word on the street is the I F F I Goa is looking particularly promising this time around, with a strong focus on South Asian cinema. So, grab your popcorn, book your tickets, and get ready for a cinematic feast! Don't miss out on the chance to see award-winning films before they hit the big screens!
